revised_title: Dislocations and Stacking Faults in Stainless Steel: Microstructure and Deformation Mechanisms
tldr: This article investigates the microstructure and deformation mechanisms of stainless steel, focusing on dislocations and stacking faults. The authors provide detailed observations and analysis of dislocation pile-ups, movement, and interactions with twin boundaries. They also discuss the formation and removal of stacking faults, which play a crucial role in the material's behavior under stress.
scientific_discipline: Materials Science > Stainless Steel Deformation Mechanisms
